intro: Passovia ensifera, commonly known as the swordleaf passovia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, giving it the common name "swordleaf." Passovia ensifera is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
